Convert N to binary, and see that it is somewhat peculiar...:


1279 1's, followed by 520 0's, and a 1.

This is because it is in the form (2^A-1)*(2^B-1)

2^1279-1 and 2^521-1 are both mersenne primes

We now know p and q, so phi can be computed with (p-1)*(q-1), and d can be computed with modInverse(e, phi)

We can then decrypt c, m = c^d (mod N)

m can then be converted to the flag by converting the bytes of m to ascii
